name: Too Min Too Max
statement: Given an array $$$a$$$ of $$$n$$$ elements, find the maximum value of the expression: $$$$$$|a_i - a_j| + |a_j - a_k| + |a_k - a_l| + |a_l - a_i|$$$$$$ where $$$i$$$, $$$j$$$, $$$k$$$, and $$$l$$$ are four distinct indices of the array $$$a$$$, with $$$1 \le i, j, k, l \le n$$$. Here $$$|x|$$$ denotes the absolute value of $$$x$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 500$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows. The first line of each test case contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$4 \le n \le 100$$$) — the length of the given array. The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$-10^6 \le a_i \le 10^6$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, print a single integer — the maximum value.
